data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: This is a great local coffee shop in downtown Fayetteville. Great service and snacks/desserts to have while you people watch from the window area or in the outdoor seating.

data.title: Excellent Chai
data.text: This is a cute little coffee shop with seating on both sides of the counter.  We chose to sit in what I will refer to as the 'living room' on the sofa while we sipped our drinks.  There was only one barista taking, and then making the orders.  She had a system down so no one had an exceptionally long wait.  She was super pleasant.  This is a laid back kind of place where you might take a book to read while you sip your beverage of choice.  The had an iced blueberry coffee available the day we were there, and my companion truly enjoyed it.  I had an iced chai latte (a questionable order in a coffee shop), and it was the best iced chai latte I've ever had.  I drink a lot of them so this is no small statement.  Give this place a try if you are in downtown Fayetteville.  Oh, and it happens to be a Pokémon Go charging station so win-win for some of you out there.

data.title: Good coffe downtown
data.text: Good selection of coffee and treats at a decent price.  Sit in front and enjoy people watching on Hay street or sit in back in the very comfy reading room for more privacy.

data.title: Kids love this spot
data.text: Coffee is good. Baked goods are passable, but kids adore this place because of downtown location and cool vibe. It's more local than Starbucks and I like supporting good folks. It's THE coffee place to go to downtown.

data.title: Busy place great coffee
data.text: This is a meeting place in downtown Fayetteville where you are sure to run into someone you know. Great place inn warmer wether for outdoor seating.

data.title: Great way to start day
data.text: I like chai tea and they have that here. Wish it were not the Oregon tea though they have append a but you have to ask for it because customers walk off with a handful they tell me. The pastries are very good and most of the time are fresh. Today I got the cinnamon roll and it was not fresh.  They need a microwave to warm them up.

data.title: Good coffee, nice seating indoors & out
data.text: I was in downtown Fayetteville, taking a walk to see if there were any new shops and decided to stop in at The Coffee Cup. I really like the atmosphere, the barista was friendly, made a really good iced mocha and answered a barrage of questions from me. I like the indoor and outdoor seating areas and will definitely be back!

data.title: The Coffee Cup Hope Mills, NC location on Camden Rd
data.text: I cannot attest to The Coffee Cup Hay St Fayetteville Location but I can testify to the one on Camden Rd, Hope Mills with the address of  in the same location as movie theater near Millstone 14. address is Millstone Towne Centre Suites #119 Hope Mills, NC. I have been there around 8 times so far. Everytime I have been there, when I come through the door, I am always greeted from where ever the workers are in the building. The sitting area is to the front, always clean, and well arranged, lighting is good. The menu board is easily found and readable. I am greeted again at the counter, no order rushing no matter how busy. The pastries and snacks I have ordered are always fresh and delicious. My coffees/teas are always prepared without rush and thoroughly. They have always tasted very good, no spilling on the outside of the cup...the cups and lids, sugars, and other things are easily in reach. I like the idea of using the Ipad to do business in taking orders. And as I said before, the workers are always friendly and personable to have a conversation and inquire of your health. I am very satisfied with going there. And the fact it is by other places I may need to go as well as the movie theatre is a plus. I love this location!!!

data.title: Disappointing
data.text:
There used to be a great coffee shop in this location, with a fun, eclectic menu and quality coffee and drinks. Apparently, this is the new name under the new ownership.

While the location still boasts the darling sitting area in the back, the rest is a complete disappointment. The menu was mediocre at best, prices high, and the quality greatly lacking. Our group ordered one hot coffee, two frappe's and a Peppermint hot cocoa. The hot coffee was "okay" but the other three of us did not even finish our drinks.

Our next coffee shop outing, we'll go back to Rude Awakening, even though the seating area is  smaller. At least the coffee will be good.
